Rainsoft seems to be a good product. But the financing company they use, Aquafinance, is a bad company. They don't do credit checks so everyone gets the same financing rate even if you would qualify for a lower one. They also open a REVOLVING credit line for their $7000 equipment. So it's going to look like you have a credit card MAXED out for years if you go by their payment plan.
I got it 2 weeks ago and my score went down 40 points.
So if you dont care about your credit score, then just sign up blindly, like I did.
If you cant afford $7k water in cash, then you shouldn't be drinking it.
The salesman seemed to forget about this.

resp.text: Sorry for your experience Dwayne. We try to use finance companies that give the customer the most flexibility. The system is designed to save you more money than it cost thru the years of ownership.

name: Ambur Love
text:
I'm giving them 2 stars based on the water being okay (not as great as the claims). We can tell a difference in taking a shower at our house vs someone else's house. Also, I was upset before about our water system purchase and had left a review and someone called me to attempt to make it right.
Now for the bad: There were so many false claims during the sales pitch. They are great scammers, so I beg you - please do not trust these people when they come into your house and force you to make a decision about their product that day! Ask as many questions as you can and take the time to read through all the paperwork! It's a good water system, but it is definitely not worth $8000 plus the extra costs they don't tell you about! Here are some lies we were told:
1. During the sales pitch we were assured we would get the Pure Selects products for life. It was part of the salesman's pitch to show us how much money we'd save because we'd no longer have to buy shampoo, detergent, soap, etc. It was never explained to us that we'd only get 4 vouchers of free product and then after that you have to pay $99 a year for only 10 products from Pure Selects. This was a huge selling point for us, because we thought we were saving some money from the huge purchase. Also, the salesman exaggerated on the quality of the products and water working together. You need more product than what they tell you, and they don't work as good as the claims.
2. We were never told that we have to get filters replaced every year and some replaced every 2 years, and these filters would cost over $100 each time.
3. We were told we didn't owe a payment for the first month or so. However, within a few weeks of our purchase we received our first bill that was due within the time frame they said we wouldn't have to pay, and was already accruing interest. They don't talk about the interest rate to you! - Ask about this!!  They say your monthly payment is like $70 or so (can't remember the exact number) that's false. The minimum payment for ours was $96 a month. They avoid talking about interest at all, do not let them get away with that! The financing company charges a daily interest rate, so that adds up!
4. Our salesman said he'd be back within 30 days of installation to retest our water and make sure we were satisfied with our purchase. False - we never heard from him again. I talked about this in my last review and someone called me and said they would send him out to our house, that never happened either.
Bottom line: Don't trust this company. They lack integrity and will do anything for your money.

Update: they give you a Health way air purifier and don't communicate that the filters for that cost $238 yearly.
Also, I saw the comment back to this from the company. We gave them the opportunity to correct the issue in the past and they did nothing, they just want to monitor these bad reviews.

name: Wade Harris
text: First, I will be positive. The drinking water is great! Very satisfying and refreshing, heck that was the whole reason we even had them come out. Responsive team and quick installation. Second, I have an issue with the honesty of the house water filtering systems. During the sales pitch it was stated that the slimy feeling on the skins was the oils not being washed off from the “harsh” water since it is now filtered. Fine sounds great love it. So we bought and start using it and I couldn’t stand the slimy feeling in the shower, might as well pour a bottle of conditioner over me... no thanks. So I call Rainsoft and tell them I’m not satisfied with that and would like to negotiate a deal. The sales rep deferred to the owner. He could care less about making a deal so he says no problem I’ll have a tech come out and move the “conditioner” to the front of the carbon filtering system. Since he wouldn’t even slightly consider making a deal on the purchase, I accepted to try it out. Slimy feeling gone. I’m satisfied... then my wheels start spinning and I start wondering why if the filtering of “harsh” water is why the oils of my skin make my hands/body feel slimy, then why when the conditioner was moved did the slimy feeling go away? If the system is “supposed” to ALWAYS be filtering the harshness then why does the conditioner even matter? But apparently I’m wrong and I’m the only person out of ten years to complain about the “slimy” feeling based off my sales rep. Here is my conclusion that it is “false advertising“ and the whole oil pitch is a hoax and the conditioner is a added fluff. I will get to the bottom of this either by losing or winning I don’t care it’s worth my effort. So if your happy with your slimy feeling system great keep enjoying! If this makes you question the integrity of the system please call and arise your concern to Mr. Williams the owner. I believe it is super wrong to make false claims. There were many other false claims made during the sales deal also... extremely disappointing and $8k... maybe $6k (not sure the drinking water price) wasted.

name: Kristin Rosin
text:
We just ordered our system and are loving it Jordan was nice enough to come back and test the system at all points to make sure that it is functioning just as they said it would. We are so excited for our great new water and the health benefits for our family.

*Update: After 2 weeks

We are still loving the water system. However we have noticed a few things that weren’t exactly clear before we bought that you might want to know:

A. The soap offered by the sales person was a big selling point. However, the soap is not the best and you will likely have to buy your own anyways.
B. They tell you that you can make payments for five years and pay it off. However if you make the minimum payment that they pitch to you, it will likely take 11 years to pay off. Also, you will pay double with interest.
C. You will need more salt for the system to clean itself than initially stated.
D. The only way to fill the reverse osmosis 5 gallon tank is to literally run good water down your drain. Be prepared to essentially pay for a water leak. I cannot believe that this was the only way to engineer the system.

So if you can live with the things above, you will like the system. We will update this as we get a few more months in.

resp.text: Thank you Kristin for your review . We are grateful for you putting your trust in  us .thank you for the update . The soaps are 100% performance guaranteed. Please call the toll free number on your soap bottle . The customer service there is great .if that doesn’t meet your expectations then please let me know . All reverse osmosis work the same . It takes getting rid of the total dissolved solids to make purified water. This is not a leak it’s the process it takes . On the financing there is no pre payment penalty for early payoff . You can manage the amount of time it will take you to pay the system off . Each home is different . Your satisfaction is very important to us . name: Ambur Love
text:
I'm giving them 2 stars based on the water being okay (not as great as the claims). We can tell a difference in taking a shower at our house vs someone else's house. Also, I was upset before about our water system purchase and had left a review and someone called me to attempt to make it right.
Now for the bad: There were so many false claims during the sales pitch. They are great scammers, so I beg you - please do not trust these people when they come into your house and force you to make a decision about their product that day! Ask as many questions as you can and take the time to read through all the paperwork! It's a good water system, but it is definitely not worth $8000 plus the extra costs they don't tell you about! Here are some lies we were told:
1. During the sales pitch we were assured we would get the Pure Selects products for life. It was part of the salesman's pitch to show us how much money we'd save because we'd no longer have to buy shampoo, detergent, soap, etc. It was never explained to us that we'd only get 4 vouchers of free product and then after that you have to pay $99 a year for only 10 products from Pure Selects. This was a huge selling point for us, because we thought we were saving some money from the huge purchase. Also, the salesman exaggerated on the quality of the products and water working together. You need more product than what they tell you, and they don't work as good as the claims.
2. We were never told that we have to get filters replaced every year and some replaced every 2 years, and these filters would cost over $100 each time.
3. We were told we didn't owe a payment for the first month or so. However, within a few weeks of our purchase we received our first bill that was due within the time frame they said we wouldn't have to pay, and was already accruing interest. They don't talk about the interest rate to you! - Ask about this!!  They say your monthly payment is like $70 or so (can't remember the exact number) that's false. The minimum payment for ours was $96 a month. They avoid talking about interest at all, do not let them get away with that! The financing company charges a daily interest rate, so that adds up!
4. Our salesman said he'd be back within 30 days of installation to retest our water and make sure we were satisfied with our purchase. False - we never heard from him again. I talked about this in my last review and someone called me and said they would send him out to our house, that never happened either.
Bottom line: Don't trust this company. They lack integrity and will do anything for your money.

Update: they give you a Health way air purifier and don't communicate that the filters for that cost $238 yearly.
Also, I saw the comment back to this from the company. We gave them the opportunity to correct the issue in the past and they did nothing, they just want to monitor these bad reviews.

To start it off, I thought it was a little rude for the lady to call me and tell me it was going to be a 15 minute test and it was not going to be a sales pitch, just for it to last over 2 hours and it was in fact a sales pitch. However, I looked past it because I was genuinely interested in how bad my water was and also that my neighbor at my old house had the system and told me all about it. So, to say the least, I wasn’t that shocked about how dirty my water was because I was expecting it. Our sales rep, I guess you would call him, was Dan Griffin and he is probably one of the most respectful guys you could ask for to come into your home and I don’t have one complaint on him. Dan, keep doing it the way you're doing it! So my wife and I decided to buy it and we honestly couldn’t be happier with it. Richard Burgess and William Skidmore installed our system and was also the most respectful people you could ask for. I don’t know where they find these people but they are very skilled and made it look very professional!

I feel like it’s a great investment for your health and for your families health. We love the way our water tastes, we feel better after showers, our dishes look cleaner, and our food taste better! For all of those interested in these things and can afford it, I would say do it. For the ones asking theirselves if they can afford a $6k system, let me give you the rundown. It’s a 9.9% interest rate which is high but is better than a banks personal loan interest rate which is about 10% at the time I bought it. Its about a $72 monthly payment. If you pay the minimum payment It’ll take you 13 years to pay it off and you will end up paying $10,600 for it and if you pay $194 monthly payment then you will pay it off in 3 years and end up paying $6,980 for it. Which is not bad because like I said it’s $6k to begin with. Another reason I didn’t have a problem paying this much for it is because it’s for life! They will come and move it for you for free one time if you was to buy another house and then they charge you for any move after that, which is reasonable.

One of the great benefits to this deal is the soaps they supply you with. They supply you with ~about~ 5 year supply of every soap, detergent and cleaner that is in your house so you won’t be buying none of that stuff for the time your paying off the loan. Might I add, the soaps and cleaners are all natural and pure ingredients. When you think about it, you spend quite a bit on shampoo, conditioner, dish soap, dish washer detergent, laundry detergent, body wash, and glass cleaner a month and you won’t have that expense anymore as long as you like it...and we love it so far.

So to sum it up, we love our system so far and I already recommend it to people. Since we have had it, we have found out a couple people also have it and one has had it for 8 years and still loves it. No doubt it’s a good system and they are not trying to pull one over on you.

Hope it helped all that was worried about what I was worried about and made a difference. Good luck!

name: Paula Dickerhoff
text: RainSoft got our name through Home Depot. Apparently they are connected, and they cold call you. Not cool. This was a product that there was no way that we were going to buy immediately but would possibly consider in the long term. They try to rope you in by saying you will save money on your cleaning products because they are roped in with another company called Pure Selects. They will sell you $8,000 worth of soaps for in the neighborhood of $350. I do not spend $800 a year on soap, let alone $8000. I doubt I spend $350, we are only two people. They said we would get a $20 Home Depot gift card, which we actually have to fill out a card and mail (and put a stamp on). They try to scare you with cancer and non-alkaline water and the Tennessee River. They test your water and you can see the minerals get solid, oh my..... The man who came to our house was nice and professional but I can see where people could easily feel pressured to purchase something that they do not need. He did not have any literature to leave us except for the "SOAP SURVEY", which I thought was odd and suspicious. Their interest rate is 9%, which they gloss over unless you ask them pointedly the question on the interest rate. They just try to tell you the monthly payments which seem reasonable until you do the math. I'm sure the product is good, though WAY overpriced. It just really bothers me that they give you no literature to try and make a decision later and they call you and talk you into them coming for a 30 minute water test. He was here about an hour and a half. They want you to buy it on the spot. It is thousands of dollars.  Also, when I googled this company along with Home Depot, there are law suits that people felt pressured into purchasing the system......I did like the way the water tasted, and it could be in my long term plan to get something like this, but I don't feel they were professional in the way the got into my house and try to scare you about the water in our area.

text:
UPDATE: Randy, the owner at Rainsoft of Huntsville reached out to me on the initial review and asked me to call him. The two gentlemen that came out to disconnect and reconnect the system, Doug and his assistant, were very polite and knowledgeable. I sincerely appreciate that Randy stood by the salesperson's word (who I will add is also no longer with the company), because I know that businesses can't just go by what customers claim.
I think my husband and I have learned a lesson out of this to ALWAYS get promises in writing. Thank you Randy, and the team at Rainsoft for fixing this.

Original post:
As a longtime customer (5 years now I think?) to one of their "top of the line" softeners, they tried to upsell us a newer version when we had a little valve go out on ours. Luckily we got the valve replaced and saved thousands of dollars by resisting an unnecessary sell.
Now that it's time to move, I called the Huntsville distributor the other day requesting a move and they said it'll be $699 for "disconnection"...I told the lady that the man that sold us our softener years ago told us that the product comes with a FREE move that does NOT expire. The rep apparently pulled up our contract on the phone and said that that's not even mentioned in our contract, and even if it were, they only honor one year out moves.
I messaged this very page a few days ago one more question (if we disconnected the softener ourselves, would the move and reconnection be less since the rep specifically said the fee is for disconnection.
It has been a few days and still no answer.

To sum it up, this company LIES, they are *extremely* pushy sales people and also try to sell unnecessarily to the customer, and their CS on social media is non-existent in my experience. Longtime customers doesn't seem to make a difference to these crooks.

text: Our delivery guy really is the best. We have no complaints. This is a very convenient service.

name: Alli Flowers
text: Frank has been bringing me water for years. So reliable.

name: L Murr
text: Our delivery guy was awesome.  Customer service is horrible.  Try to cancel your account...IMPOSSIBLE.  their customer serve phone number is a total joke.

name: Lisa Fox
text: Love the products and services

resp.text:
Hello Valued Customer,
Thank you for the kind words, Lisa! We're so glad to receive the positive feedback.
Kind regards,
Prescilla S.

name: Brenda Bryant
text: Great products and great customer service from service center to our delivery guy!

name: Jared Freye
text: So easy to work with and never misses a delivery.

name: Andy Tubertini
text: Water cooler never cooled water. Cooler changed out several times and it never did work, however, we were billed and had to pay.

name: Tom Sigg
text: Fast unload load time. Took only an hour.

name: David Riddle
text:
Requested water delivery and received the following email.

Your delivery request has been received. Someone will contact you shortly.

Thank you!
The Crystal Mountain Water Team

27 days later and no response.

resp.text:
Hey David,
Thank you for bringing to our attention that we have a problem with that feature on our website!  We would love to have your business please give us a call at 256-922-1114 or H2Oinfo@crystalmtnwater.com

name: R Trev
text: After having many problems with Crystal Springs we signed up with Crystal Mountain and have been very pleased. The purified water tastes nice and customer service is efficient with great southern charm.

name: Becca Sadriyev
text: Amazing customer service from this Company. After a disappointing end to service with another company, this one stepped up and has been a blessing to work with. Highly recommended.

resp.text: Hey Becca! Please call our office at 256-922-1114

name: Paul Burns
text: I've had two accounts for many years.  I think it's been around 9 years.  Have one account at work, and had one account at home.  I had to cancel the home account because the delivery schedule changed almost every month.  I would get random deliveries, or not get a delivery at all.  Sometimes my empty bottles would sit outside for a month.  I just couldn't keep storing empties until I hit the delivery lottery.  My work account has been great, though.  And the customer service has been pretty good.

name: Mike S
text: Been out of water for a week now. We have called twice and they said they would be out the next day and never show up. Now when you call they go straight to voicemail.

resp.text: Hey Mike ! Please give our office a call at 256-922-1114

name: Georgia Benford
text: Water is like drinking figi and that's great for me so smooth

name: Jon Owings
text: used them for home delivery almost 20 years, rare misdeliveries which are quickly corrected, essentially good service and product.  My experience has been good overall.

name: Regina League
text: My office has been a customer for over a year now. In the last few months their customer service has declined drastically.  As of today we have waited 1 week for our delivery of distilled water.  Something to make things easier for us, has turned out to be just as difficult has our making a trip to the market for water ourselves. Very disappointing.

name: eli williams
text: I am a 53 ft tractor trailer driver and this place is one of the worse getting into.  Do not try to enter from Madison Pike try Governors.  Once inside industrial park, watch for low hanging trees, branches, etc. Bldg 7 is in the very rear. Horrible location for 53ft tractor trailer deliveries.

name: I FULLENWIDER
text: Their products are very  expensive

name: Jeremy Patton
text: Very nice company and good water product options!!!

name: Doug Schroeder
text: Great service and great water!

name: Carolyn Dietrich
text: Jim Durden, who we fondly call "Water Boy" is an amazing person to know at Uniquely Water.  I have known him for years and knew that he took care of many businesses around town, so we decided to hire him to install a water filtration system in my real estate office.  All I can say is I wish I had done it years earlier!  Best drink of water EVER!  Jim was professional, informative and efficient.  We will never go anywhere else and are so happy to be able to offer our clients fresh cool water or hot water for tea and hot chocolate.  Thank you Jim Durden of Uniquely Water for everything you do. You are simply the best in town!

name: Stephen Rice
text: We have UW's filtered water coolers both at our office and home. We will never go back to the 5 gallon jug again! Convenient, eco friendly and tastes great!

name: thomas dunnavant
text: I  used this water service as a reminder to some of Real Estate agencies that i appreciate their referrals to my Home Inspection business and got very favorable results and lots of good water

name: Tina Parker
text: I had it installed at my office and my house, much better than bottled water in taste, price and convenience.  I use it for all my cooking and drinking water.

name: Karen Brian
text: Culligan of Mobile went out of their way to sanitize my house's plumbing system after a water test showed positive for Mycobacterium Avium. They also placed an ultraviolet system on my main water supply. Subsequent tests have come back negative for the bacteria. They are life-savers. I can't thank them enough for all their help and consideration. They are truly professionals and extremely knowledgeable in this area. Kudos to you Culligan!

name: Toya Coverson
text: They have delicious clean tasting water. Excellent customer service and contact free delivery. Just put the bottles by the front door and they replace them. I don't have a lot of strength,  so I opted for the 3 gallon bottles and the bottom feeder dispenser. Very stylish and simple to use

resp.text: Hi Toya, thank you so much for taking the time to write a review on Google! I am so happy to hear that you are satisfied with our customer service and our bottled water.  The bottom loader dispensers are awesome because you don't have to lift those heavy bottles! We appreciate your business with us and hope you have a great weekend!

name: MJ Chamblin
text: Great price for great tasting water! They were super helpful when I signed up for delivery and always deliver on time.

name: Rupert Ward,Jr.
text: PMS is on point that brings great water throughout my whole home. Investing in Culligan has been the best and thank you for keeping safety 1st....#ALREADY!!

resp.text: Hello Rupert! Thank you so much for positive review on Google! We are so pleased to hear that you are happy with our service and that you now have great water in your home! We strive here for great service and the safety of our customers and employees always. We appreciate your business with us and hope you have a great rest of your week!

name: Pia Lee
text: Getting great water delivered right to your home is such a great convenience. Getting it from a great company like Culligan is amazing. Customer service is spot on, always friendly, always prompt.  My delivery man is courteous and professional.  We drink a lot of water in our house, Culligan makes is affordable and earth friendly.

resp.text: Hi Pia! Thank you so much for taking the time to write this amazing review! I would love to share this on our Facebook page, if that is OK with you.  We truly appreciate you explaining your positive experience with Culligan. Thanks again, and hope you have a fantastic weekend!

name: Tosha Capell
text: I called on a Monday and set up new services I was told that by Tuesday no later than Wednesday I would have my bottles. Here it is today is Thursday and I’m being told they are too busy I can leave a message. Well I the message I left was to cancel my order.  Their customer service is horrible.

name: Emily Chinal
text: Googled for home water delivery of spring water. Found them and they deliver to my remote area. Great customer service and auto pay available. Guy delivered on the first as stated. Great tasting spring water. Awesome! Very pleased!

resp.text: Hello Emily, thank you so much for rating us on Google! We are so happy to hear that you are enjoying our Spring Water. We appreciate your business with us and hope you have a fantastic week!

name: Theron Adams
text: We've been in our house 13 years, and Culligan has been with us from the beginning. Our water is crystal clear and tastes delicious. Stop buying all the plastic bottles and save the planet. Get Culligan.

resp.text: Hello Theron, thank you so much for this wonderful review!  We are so pleased to hear that your water tastes delicious, and that you are happy with the quality of water.  Hope you have a fantastic weekend!

name: Rick Hurst
text: Excellent service!

resp.text: Hi Rick! Thank you so much for rating us 5-stars on Google. We appreciate the positive feedback and hope you have a great rest of your week!

name: Janna Perry
text: We have had water delivery for a few years now.  We love the water & have had very few problems over the years, but anytime there has been any issue, the nice people at Culligan have handled it quickly and efficiently.

resp.text: Hello Janna, thank you so much for this amazing review! We strive here at Culligan to provide our customers with the best customer experience. Thank you again so much for sharing and have a fantastic day!

name: Timothy Toomey
text: Our patients love having Culligan Water in all of our Gulf Coast waiting rooms!

resp.text: Hello Timothy! Thank you so much for sharing your experience with Culligan Water. We are so pleased to hear that your patients love our water!

name: maryann jeeves
text: Wonderful service! And great products!

resp.text: Hello Maryann, thank you so much for taking the time to rate us on Google! We appreciate the kind words and love to hear that you are happy with our service. Have a fantastic day!

name: Liss
text: Service is great! The water tastes great and the price is excellent.

resp.text:
Thank you so much for sharing this review with our dealership! Along with reliable products and quality water, we take pride in providing professional, convenient and friendly service to all customers, so we're happy to hear about your positive experience. Please let us know if there's anything we can help you with in the future. Thanks again.

Best,

Tim St. Gelais
General Manager of Culligan of Mobile
tim.stgelais@fortwaltonculligan.com
(850) 664-7771

name: Mel Blue
text: Great service and customer service.

resp.text: Hello Mel! Thank you so much for providing us a review and for the kind words.  We love to hear that you are satisfied with our customer service and service work. Here at Culligan, we strive to provide our customers with great customer service and exceptional service work done by our trained technicians.  We appreciate your business with us and hope you have a fantastic weekend!

name: Sammie King
text: We love our Culligan Water and our Culligan man!

resp.text: Hi Sammie, thank you for taking the time to provide us with a review of your experience. I am pleased to hear that our team made your experience pleasant and we look forward to seeing you again soon!

name: Shane Glasgow
text: Water was not good, tasted like Dasani. I don't know why Micheal is running a water cartel but hes not good at it.

name: Denise Kivette
text: This water truly tastes fresh and there’s no weird after taste.  It actually has a different mouth feel.  It’s pretty much ruined other bottled water for me.

name: Terry Greenslade
text: Good water.

name: Ashton Washington
text: Best water I’ve ever had! Crisp, fresh taste especially in the heat on the football field.

name: Tonya Long
text: This is the best wayer ever! I love the  taste so much that I don't have to mix my water packets with it I can drink it plain and I never could do that with any other water. I love that is comes from the same county that I  live in and knowing the history behind it. I think that God gave us a little taste of our own living water here on earth. I love it and will not drink anything else as long as I can find or buy directly from the source.

name: Derek
text: One of the best tasting water, rivaling Evian and Fiji. I've always loved Fiji water and one of the main reason beyond taste is the label that gives you the PH level. Wish Blue Spring would provide that on the label. Overall Blue Spring water is extremely good and best part is it is local and I love supporting local businesses. Thanks for all you do Blue Spring.

name: Lee Dobbs
text: Best water I ever tasted.

name: Sharky Haygood
text: This water is the best! I wish it was more where I live.

name: Curtis Chappell
text: All natural water

name: Spencer Lacey
text: Velvety smooth.

name: Linda Nuss
text: Best water ever!!!!
